title: NSW settles on seven Western Sydney Metro station sites
text:
The state government is yet to indicate how the above-station development contracts will be split up.

The NSW government has identified seven sites for the planned Western Sydney Metro rail line that will connect the Sydney central business district to Parramatta by a 20-minute train ride.

Construction work will begin next year at the Bays Precinct, the first station outside the CBD, with preparation for major tunnelling works, Premier Gladys Berejiklian said on Monday. Work is under way to determine the location of the new metro station in the CBD.

The other confirmed stations on the route west are Five Dock, Burwood North, North Strathfield, Sydney Olympic Park, Parramatta and Westmead. The state government will also investigate the feasibility of metro stations in Pyrmont and at Rydalmere.

The silhouette of NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian is reflected against a map of the finalised Western Sydney Metro route on Monday. Sam Mooy

"The Western Sydney Metro will fundamentally change how we get around our city for generations to come, connecting Greater Parramatta and the Sydney CBD with fast, safe and reliable metro rail,” Ms Berejiklian said.

The journey from Wynyard to Parramatta on the existing rail network takes about 33 minutes.
description: The state government is yet to indicate how the above-station development contracts will be split up.
